title: Yorkshire breaking news: Latest updates - BBC News
summary: flash flooding in west and north yorkshire after heavy rain hits .
driver rams police car in bradford .
tree campaigners hold 'peaceful protest ' in sheffield .
north yorkshire bus firm goes into liquidation .
bells to ring out again at york minster after new team appointed .
north should 'take control ' of transport - transport secretary .
police investigate 'lizard on the loose ' in halifax .

documents.title: that 's all from wednesday
text: those are all our updates from yorkshire on wednesday 23 august 2017 .
want to find out what 's happening where you live on thursday 24 august ?
just click here .

documents.title: five things we learned today
text: that 's all from us for today , we 'll be back tomorrow from 06:30 with all the latest news , sport , weather and travel for yorkshire .
updates on breaking news will continue throughout the night , but before we go , let 's look back at some of our top stories from today :
see you tomorrow .

documents.title: man slashed in stomach at doncaster nightclub
text: a man needed hospital treatment after being knifed in the stomach at doncaster nightclub warehouse , where he had been clubbing with friends and his partner .
the 30-year-old man also suffered facial injuries after being attacked with a knife inside the venue on marsh gate .
police have appealed for witnesses to the assault , which happened in the early hours of last sunday , august 13 , at around 02.10 bst .

documents.title: north of england 's 'huge economic potential being held back ' , say leaders
text: the north of england 's `` huge economic potential is being held back by an out-dated , expensive and slow transport system '' , northern leaders say .

a delegation of political and business officials at cloth hall court have issued a joint statement , in which they have called for `` substantial new investment in modern infrastructure linking the great cities of the north '' .

among those who have been attending the event are leaders of leeds , newcastle , sheffield and manchester councils , mayor of greater manchester andy burnham , liverpool city region metro mayor steve rotheram and business representatives .
we believe that people across the north have waited long enough for transport services on a par with other parts of the country .
the disparity between transport in the north of england and london must now be addressed ''
author: Pritti Mistry
BBC News Online

documents.title: bus passengers left stranded as company goes into liquidation
text: a north yorkshire bus firm announced it had gone into liquidation today - leaving its rush hour passengers waiting at bus stops .
utopia buses , was based in sherburn-in-elmet and had routes through selby , drax , tadcaster and york .
the bbc has tried to contact both the firm and the administrator this afternoon so far , no one has been available for comment .
routes affected :

documents.title: what 's the highlight of leeds carnival ?
text: what 's the highlight of leeds carnival ?

documents.title: parking meters ready for new £ 1 coin five months after circulation began
text: five months after the new £ 1 coin was introduced , parking meters on a north yorkshire high street have been updated to accept it .
the new coins came into circulation in march .
north yorkshire county council says the conversion work in northallerton was done as soon as was possible .
councillor don mackenzie said : every effort was made to complete this conversion work at the earliest opportunity to minimise any inconvenience to drivers and we thank them for their patience . ''

documents.title: countdown to 50th leeds carnival
text: leeds carnival is the `` oldest carnival in europe '' and is still looking to the future .
up to 150,000 people are expected to turn out on the streets of chapeltown for leeds carnival over the august bank holiday weekend - many of them under 20 years of age .
the west indian carnival started in 1967 and has since taken place every year :

documents.title: sheffield 's richard hawley goes for a walk on radio 2
text: janice long features sheffield singer-songwriter richard hawley on her radio 2 show tonight .

they spend quite a lot of time in the bar and music room of richard 's local the greystones - which has played host to richard himself along with pulp , martin simpson and duane eddy and then they take richard 's dogs alf and fred to the nearby bingham park .
richard talks about growing up with his musical parents and the changing musical , political and social atmosphere in sheffield from the 1960s to the present day .
the programme is on radio 2 at 22:00 tonight .

documents.title: watch : questions over lack of senior police under investigation in rotherham
text: dr angie heal a former police analyst who wrote a report on the rotherham abuse scandal says she has concerns that the senior command team has never been investigated .
she has been speaking to the victoria derbyshire programme on bbc1 :
a former police analyst who wrote a report on rotherham abuse scandal says it 's concerning that senior police have not been investigated
these in authority are horrifically failing all affected by this horrific crime !
no more silence !
sosa thriver empowered ea.uk
what on earth is happening in rotherham ?
who is protecting police authorities and leadership ?
the media have a duty to shake this thing up !
investigate then prosecute

documents.title: stairs like a waterfall in scarborough
text: just look at this incredible of flooding in scarborough a little earlier today after torrential rain hit north and west yorkshire :
cynthia scott sent us this dramatic pic from scalby road , off whinbank .
if you 've got any you want to send us , you can do so by simply clicking here .

documents.title: pilot crash lands aircraft by river
text: pilot crash lands aircraft by river

documents.title: sheffield council taking legal advice after protest
text: sheffield city council says it is disappointed at the peaceful public protest outside the olive grove depot today .
just hours after a ban on direct action to prevent tree felling came into force , the protesters tried a new tactic :
the council is now taking legal advice about how best to proceed and is working closely with colleagues at south yorkshire police with whom primary responsibility lies for enforcing the law ''
the moment the tree-felling blockade in sheffield occurred today at olive grove road @ twitterid
why is everyone videoing it ?
the age of social media and i do because it 's now required for the job
was n't aimed really at you ( a journalist ) , everyone else i was meaning .
because @ twitterid were trying to accuse campaigners of breaking injunction .
and videoing does what ?
i do n't understand how a contractor working for any council does not have to show any identification , if an in house service they would ?
this is the only way to make the council question their actions in the future , proud to see sheffielders kicking back against the apathy .
`` and tomorrow and the next day we 'll be preventing you on the streets ''
who 's that in the pink ?
peaceful protests .
freedom of speech .
well done # protesters # respect # savethetrees
who 's the threatening prick in the pink t shirt ?
arrest the lot of them for breaching the injunction , they ca n't do much whilst being locked up
all strength to you .
good people doing good things
strength and solidarity of sheffielders to keep our trees is fantastic !
have they all got masks on
run the bastards over
author: Kate Linderholm
BBC Local Live, Sheffield

documents.title: teacher ban over ex-pupil relationship
text: teacher ban over ex-pupil relationship

documents.title: bbc 's dinnerladies actor appointed patron of york charity
text: the york-based charity jessie 's fund has appointed the actor maxine peake as its new patron .
she starred in victoria wood 's sitcom dinnerladies and actually takes over the role from victoria who died last year .
the charity helps seriously ill children to communicate using music .

documents.title: north of england 'needs transport investment now ' , says andy burnham
text: the north of england `` needs transport investment now '' , the mayor of greater manchester said as northern leaders gather at a transport summit in leeds .
in a tweet , andy burnham said : `` we are here with one loud , clear and strong voice - the north . ''
political and businesses who want more investment in local infrastructure are meeting at cloth hall court .
mr burnham said the conference was a `` packed house '' .
packed house for today 's # transportsummit we are here with one loud , clear and strong voice - the north needs transport investment now
make grayling squirm
the economic costs of # brexit may put spanner in the works andy .
best get jc & rest of labour bigwigs figuring an exit from # brexit .
north will not get £ from con govt because they do not need to win seats in north .
vide grayling today .
# andyburnham while you have people as ignorant and visionless as # chrisgrayling and # philiphammond to deal with # northernpowerhouse is d.o.a
andy , i like the cut of your jib .
keep it up son .
manchester is great , the north is great .
one loud , clear and strong voice and three hashtags # transportsummit17 # transportsummit # transportsummit2017
author: Pritti Mistry
BBC News Online

documents.title: fire service release details of flood call outs
text: this morning two week 's worth of rain fell on parts of yorkshire in just a couple of hours .
west yorkshire fire and rescue has released details of the types of calls they got in those two hours :
calls taken by west yorkshire fire and rescue service :
between 09:00 and 11:15 this morning took 23 calls about floods around the area , they went to seven of those and they were mainly in the leeds and wetherby areas .

text: a fortnight 's worth of rain fell in just a couple of hours in north and west yorkshire this morning causing flash flooding and problems on the roads .
here 's how it looked as motorists struggled and roads turned into rivers :

police say engine failure was to blame and the pilot escaped unhurt .

documents.title: convict who 'thought about killing everyday ' made knife in prison
text: a man jailed for life for murdering a builder in plymouth told a prison officer he `` thought about killing everyday '' , leeds crown court heard .
donald pemberton ( above ) was convicted alongside ryan williams of murdering tanis bhandari ( below ) near the kings arms pub in tamerton foliot in 2015 .
the 22-year-old , who was jailed for life with a minimum term of 23 years , was found covered in blood and possessing a makeshift knife by a prison officer at hmp wakefield in april .
he had removed the blade from his razor to make an eight-inch weapon and told her that he `` could not stop thinking about killing '' .
pemberton , who pleaded guilty to possession of a knife , was jailed for two years concurrent to his original sentence .

documents.title: missing from doncaster - have you seen robert trueman ?
text: police are asking for your help to locate a man who has been missing for almost a month .
robert trueman , 48 , was last seen in edlington , doncaster on 28 july after telling his partner he was off to work .
he has not been seen or heard from since and there are concerns for his welfare .
robert is described as being white , medium height with dark grey hair , and of medium build with a red devil tattoo on his arm .

documents.title: flash flood turns streets into rivers
text: flash flood turns streets into rivers

documents.title: traffic and travel : seven miles of traffic on m62
text: a crash on the m62 westbound between j24 and j25 is causing just under seven miles of delays this afternoon .
here 's the scene just before j25 :
the air ambulance has been sent to the scene and some people have spoken of delays of about 40 minutes so far .
highways england says it does n't expect the road to be clear again for at least another hour .
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: fire service in scarborough struggling after torrential rain
text: fire services in scarborough say they are struggling to cope with the number of incidents in the town following torrential rain :
they 're in what 's called `` spate '' conditions , which means the number of incidents is outstripping the resources available .

the emergency services define it in the following terms : `` the number of appliances in the existing fleet may not be sufficient to deal with the number of calls being received within normal performance . ''
this shows just one of the areas affected , part of valley road in scarborough , a few minutes ago :
we are experiencing a high volume of calls for flooding in # scarborough eight fire engine are assisting residents in various areas .
just want to say thank you for attending our flooded house .
keep safe everyone
@ twitterid you 're doing a fantastic job , keep it up guys !

documents.title: have you seen this man ?
text: british transport police have tweeted a cctv image of a man wanted in connection with a theft from doncaster railway station :
a bag was stolen from doncaster station containing a laptop .
we want to speak with this man in connection .
do you know him ?
text 61016 .
get in touch and quote reference 453 of 06/08/2017 .
thank you .

text: here 's the latest on an incident that 's ongoing on the m62 this afternoon :
traffic released e/b on # m62 , it remains blocked w/b btwn j24 + j25 nr # huddersfield due to a collision .
air ambo at scene + @ twitterid
are u expecting it to be open in the next hr or 2 west bound ?

documents.title: watch : driver rams police car in bradford
text: police in bradford have published a video of the shocking moment a driver reversed into one of their patrol cars :
officers say that the driver backed into their car on otley road on monday and they 're now trying to trace the person responsible .
it caused a lot of damage to their car as you can see :
if you have any information about the incident , police are asking you to get in touch .

documents.title: in damage to batley bulldogs ground after four break-ins in four weeks
text: we mentioned earlier that batley bulldogs ' mount pleasant ground has been broken into four times in as many weeks .
as the club appeals for help in finding the culprits , here are some of the damage at the ground :

documents.title: flooding causes york city centre traffic chaos
text: there are serious traffic problems in york at the moment as racegoers trying to reach york knavesmire for the ebor meeting are diverted due to flooding .
severe delays are currently being experienced because of the closure of the a1036 one-way system in the city-centre due to floodwater .

documents.title: flood problems continue in scarborough
text: we mentioned a while ago about flooding in parts of scarborough .
it 's still causing problems and has sparked this warning from the fire service :
flooding still being reported across scarborough please take care in that area , do n't drive through flood water if you do n't know its depth

documents.title: man arrested after crash near penistone
text: a man has been arrested after a crash overnight at oxspring , near penistone .
emergency services were called to a serious road traffic collision at four lane ends at about 12:25 this morning .
the incident involved a single car containing five occupants .
a 29-year-old man has been arrested on sus of driving offences .
the road is currently closed with diversions in place and it 's expected to remain closed throughout the morning .

documents.title: first million-pound horse race to be staged at york
text: history 's due to be made in york this afternoon as the world 's top thoroughbreds compete for the city 's first million-pound horse race .
this afternoon , seven of the best horses will battle it out for the record-breaking prize money in the juddmonte international at the ebor festival .
the festival itself will be on for the next four days and the juddmonte international will be the richest race ever run at york .

away from the track , there are some impressive food stats involved : there will be 80 chefs , 2,000 catering staff , 2,000 crabs delivered from the coast everyday and 3,000 homemade beefburgers will be made .

documents.title: warning over flood water in scarborough
text: scarborough 's one of the places in north yorkshire currently feeling the impact of this morning 's heavy rain .
here 's the latest warning from the county 's fire service :
reports of a lot of standing water on valley road # scarborough at the moment .
please avoid the area @ twitterid

documents.title: watch : flooding in dewsbury
text: this was the scene in one dewsbury street after the heavy rain fell this morning .
shabban abbas sent us the footage showing roads , paths and gardens all under water :

documents.title: flash flooding : york buses latest
text: first york have just released details of how the rain and floodwater is affecting bus services in york :
due to flash flooding , roads are closed and diverted traffic is causing severe congestion .
all services are delayed .
apologies .

documents.title: 'welcome to sunny leeds ' : heavy rain ahead of leeds festival site opening
text: the gates will be opening later this afternoon at the leeds festival camp site ahead of the big event this weekend .
after this morning 's heavy rain , here 's hoping everybody 's prepared for the best of british weather and its aftermath :
welcome to sunny # leeds @ twitterid ground should now be nice & soft for campers tentpegs !
have a great ( & dry ) # leedsfestival2017

documents.title: flood warnings and alerts for west yorkshire
text: following heavy rain in west yorkshire , three environment agency flood warnings remain in place for leeds at the moment .
they are for wyke beck at dunhills in halton , wyke beck at fearnville and wyke beck at wykebeck valley road in gipton .
the warning means that flooding is expected and `` immediate action is required '' by people living and working nearby .
meanwhile , environment agency flood alerts are currently in place at wyke beck , meanwood beck and wortley beck in leeds .
the alerts mean that flooding is possible and that people in the affected areas must be prepared .

documents.title: watch : fishergate in york flooded
text: this was the scene earlier on fishergate in york .
the band of rain which swept across parts of yorkshire appears to have dumped about 40mm of rain in just one hour .
haley pugh captured the video below :

documents.title: flooding closes york 's fishergate
text: the rain which hit west yorkshire earlier this morning is also causing problems in york just now .
at least one road in the city centre is currently closed due to flooding :
fishergate is currently closed to traffic and pedestrians due to flash flooding .
highways are on scene .
please avoid until further notice .

documents.title: tree protesters prevent felling crews leaving sheffield depot
text: about 40 tree protesters in sheffield have prevented felling crews from leaving amey 's olive grove depot today .
sheffield city council was granted a high court injunction last week that came in to effect this morning .
but it only prevents protesters from entering safety zones around trees due to be felled and not other forms of protest .
officers on the scene told campaigners the injunction did not give them any powers of arrest .

documents.title: flash flooding in leeds keeps emergency services busy
text: problems are continuing in west yorkshire - especially in leeds - this morning following heavy rain .
west yorkshire fire service and west yorkshire police say they 're particularly busy at the moment :
since 9.30am we 've received a lot of calls to our control room relating to weather , especially in the leeds district .
take care out there .
we are working together with all the local authorities dealing with the weather disruptions today .
# workingtogether

documents.title: the signs are on : ikea store taking shape
text: it does n't open until september 28 but the iconic blue and yellow logos are now up at the new ikea store coming to sheffield .
the 35,000 sq m building is at the old tinsley wire site near meadowhall and will have a crèche , restaurant , bistro and car park with 1,380 free spaces .

documents.title: sandbags at the ready
text: i 'm in parker road in dewsbury .
local residents say the scene below happens every time it rains .
they 've had to buy their own sand bags .
author: Alasdair Gill
Journalist, BBC Look North

text: if you were out driving during the rain we 've had this morning , i do n't envy you .

crazy weather in # yorkshire thunder lightening heavy rain scary driving .

documents.title: yorkshire sculpture park closes some exhibits
text: you may have already thought twice about trudging around the yorkshire sculpture park today because of the rain .
they 've just tweeted that they 've had to close a few parts of it because of the downpours this morning :
unfortunately , due to heavy rain this morning , the bothy gallery and seizure by roger hiorns are closed until further notice

documents.title: good samaritan from doncaster attack urged to come forward
text: police want to contact a man who stopped to help the victim of an attack on north bridge road 10 days ago and then drove the injured man home .
sometime between 01:30 and 03:15 on sunday 13 august a 24-year-old was beaten up by a gang of men .
a man passing in a car stopped and drove him home .
the police and the victim want to thank him for his assistance and want to speak to him about what happened as they continue searching for the attackers .

there 's flash flooding on the one-way system in york 's fishergate area and a listener to bbc radio york has said the rain has caused the drain covers to be lifted in easingwold .

documents.title: sheffield tree protestors warned as demo grows
text: more tree campaigners have turned up to what they 're calling a `` peaceful protest '' outside the olive grove depot of sheffield city council contractors amey .
now amey officials have warned them that the police have been called .
protesting outside the depot where arborists ' vehicles leave to cut down trees is a new tactic .
it comes just hours after a high court injunction came into force stopping people from taking direct action to prevent trees being removed .
anyone breaking the order will be in contempt of court and could face a fine or even a prison sentence .
campaigners at olive grove this morning say their protest is n't breaking the injunction .

about 5,500 trees have been felled in sheffield since the start of the council 's £ 2.2bn 25-year programme of works , having been assessed as either dangerous , dead , diseased , dying , damaging or discriminatory - meaning restricting access or otherwise unhelpfully placed ' .
they are being replaced with saplings .
author: Andy Kershaw
BBC Radio Sheffield News

we 've seen a torrential downpour which has caught many out and left quite a few large puddles dotted around :
leeds ' inner ring road looked more like a boating lake :

documents.title: missing leeds woman 'safe and well '
text: we 've had an update on a story we ran yesterday on the search for a missing leeds woman .
police say that emily wyatt/barraclough has now been found `` safe and well '' .
officers say they 're very grateful to everyone who shared their appeal for help in finding her .

documents.title: the bollywood epic filming in yorkshire
text: the bollywood epic filming in yorkshire
author: Ian Youngs
Entertainment reporter

documents.title: man walks away from 200mph crash near york
text: a man has walked away from a 200mph crash while attempting to break the uk land speed record at an airfield near york .
david tremayne , 64 , from darlington , reached a top speed of 296mph at elvington airfield before losing control when the parachute fired .
mr tremayne climbed out of the car with just a cut to his finger :

documents.title: rotherham youth worker nominated for national award
text: a youth worker from rotherham is in the running for a national award .
nicola harding works at myplace performance youth and arts centre and has been shortlisted for the title of young worker of the year in the youth matters award 2017 .
as part of her work , nicola has set about changing the lives of disadvantaged young people in rotherham - especially people from the roma community .

documents.title: watch : rain this morning , brighter later
text: mostly cloudy and mist this morning with outbreaks of thundery rain spreading northeastwards .
the rain will ease and the cloud will break from the west later to allow sunny spells to develop .
watch my full forecast here :
author: Lisa Gallagher
Weather presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: batley bulldogs baffled over vandalism and break-ins
text: batley bulldogs ' mount pleasant ground has been broken into and vandalised four times in just a month , the club 's revealed .
club boss and former bulldogs player paul harrison ( is now appealing to the local community to come forward with any information about the break-ins .
they club 's now taken to social media to try and catch the culprits , posting this cctv footage of the break in :

documents.title: traffic and travel : accident closes five roads near penistone
text: drivers are being warned that five roads have been closed after an accident at oxspring near penistone .
the affected routes are :
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: public warned not to approach wanted selby man
text: members of the public are being warned by police not to approach a man wanted for five breaches of a non-molestation order and a threat to kill .
officers are appealing for information about the whereabouts of matthew alan stanley , 27 , from selby , who is currently believed to be in south yorkshire .
anyone who sees stanley is warned to call the police `` immediately '' .

documents.title: tree campaigners hold 'peaceful protest ' in sheffield
text: tree campaigners have gathered for a `` peaceful protest '' outside the depot of sheffield city council contractors amey to mark the start of a court order against direct action .

the high court injunction , which came into force at midnight and lasts until 25 july next year , means people ca n't stand within safety barriers when contractors from amey are felling trees in the city and ca n't prevent the barriers from being put up .

peaceful protests outside safety zones are still allowed , so protesters who are upset about the number of roadside trees being felled in sheffield as part of the council 's programme have gathered outside the olive grove depot .

about 5,500 trees have been felled in sheffield since the start of the £ 2.2bn 25-year programme of works , having been assessed as either dangerous , dead , diseased , dying , damaging or discriminatory .
they are being replaced with saplings .

documents.title: up to speed ? northern transport in spotlight at special summit
text: business leaders and politicians from across northern england are due to meet in leeds later to discuss transport across the north .
there are calls for the government to invest billions of pounds in projects to improve our railways and roads .
yesterday , the northern powerhouse minister , jake berry , said a high-speed rail line between liverpool and hull will happen .
and writing in the yorkshire post today , the transport secretary chris grayling says the north of england 's leaders should `` take control '' of their own transport networks .
more than 100 people will be at the transport summit and will hear from speakers including the leader of leeds city council , judith blake .

documents.title: boom , boom ! : fox rescued from deep well in sheffield
text: firefighters in south yorkshire rescued a fox stuck down a 10ft-deep dry well last night .
the special animal rescue team from tankersley was sent to majuba street in sheffield to save the trapped fox .
after its rescue , the animal was handed over to the rspca :
well done tankersley crew saving a fox trapped down a disused well .

documents.title: off the scale : lizard on the loose in calderdale ?
text: sightings of a giant lizard roaming the streets of halifax have been reported to the police .
officers in the town have been investigating suspected sightings of a monitor lizard similar to the one above .
monitor lizards have long necks , powerful tails and claws , with the adult 's length ranging from 20cm ( 7.9 in ) in some species to over 3m ( 10 ft ) .
they have forked tongues , which they use to detect scents in the air .
many of them are good swimmers and this family includes the largest lizard on earth , the komodo dragon .
so far the police in halifax have n't found anything , but some people in the area suspect an illegal pet has got loose .

documents.title: yorkshire 's wet wednesday weather forecast
text: cloudy and misty at first for yorkshire with long periods of thundery rain .
the rain will slowly move northwards during the morning , allowing some drier , brighter weather to arrive by the afternoon .
sunny spells developing from mid-afternoon .
mainly light winds .
this evening will see long clear spells at first , allowing some mist or fog patches to form :

documents.title: bells to ring out again at york minster after new team appointed
text: york minster has recruited a new band of volunteer bell-ringers after the entire previous ringing team was sacked last october over what the minster described as safeguarding issues .
several members of the former band are included in the new team which will get together for the first time next month .
the minster 's 12 bells were silent on christmas day for the first time in more than 600 years after the break-up of the bell-ringing team .
one group of campanologists from leeds reportedly refused to help out , in solidarity with their sacked york colleagues .

the chapter said it disbanded the team after ringers refused to accept a decision not to reinstate one member , who had been suspended following a police investigation into allegations of sex offending against children which did not lead to a prosecution .
a minster spokeswoman said more than 40 applications were received from york and the wider region and the new band will be led by headteacher angela mitchell .

documents.title: rotherham abuse : whistleblower investigation 'examined '
text: the handling of an investigation into the woman who first revealed the child sexual abuse scandal in rotherham is to be examined , the bbc 's victoria derbyshire programme has learned .
jayne senior has been investigated by rotherham council for a year after a number of complaints .
it is understood the local government ombudsman has now said it will look into her treatment .
rotherham council said it had a duty to ensure complaints were considered .
author: Alison Holt
Victoria Derbyshire Programme

documents.title: check your train journey this morning
text: if you 're heading out to catch a train this morning , you 'll be happy to know the services across our region seem to be generally running to time at the moment .
you can click on the links below to keep up-to-date with the live departure boards for :
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: north should 'take control ' of transport , says grayling
text: the north of england 's leaders should `` take control '' of their own transport networks , chris grayling has said .
writing in the yorkshire post , the transport secretary said : `` the success of northern transport depends on the north itself . ''
the article comes ahead of a transport summit in the region to be attended by local leaders and businesses .
mayor of greater manchester andy burnham said the event shows `` the patience of people has run out '' .
in the article , mr grayling said while one of his `` biggest priorities '' was to build transport links in the north , it was down to the region to design and manage them .

documents.title: good morning : join us for today 's live coverage across yorkshire
text: hello and welcome to bbc local live in yorkshire on wednesday 23 august 2017 .
we 'll be with you throughout the day with all the latest news , sport , travel and weather updates .
in an effort to wring the most out of what 's left of the summer , how about starting today with this warming and colourful whitby beach hut shot from one of our bbc weather watchers ?
if you 've taken any you 'd like to share with the rest of yorkshire , it could n't be easier .
you can do so by simply clicking here .
